ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: 1. I bought but never used the text book. I did read E thoroughly.

I have never liked math and have never been good at it and this was by far my favorite course this semester. It was an excellent class and I highly recommend it to ALL FES students regardless of background. Eli provides a great overview of the math concepts in the context of environmental studies. Anyone that takes it will come away with a thorough understanding and level of comfort with these math concepts.
I don't understand why there is no question regarding the teaching assistant in this class.

This course provided a fantastic refresher (for me at least) and overview of key areas of math and how they applied to environmental work. Also, the focus is on understanding the concepts at a higher level rather than rote memorization of mathematical rules - meaning that you understand how and why you use different methods and approaches to solve problems so you can determine the best approaches for solving problems.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The combination of outside reading, problem sets that both had practice problems and word problems, online videos, and in-class learning really made complex mathematical concepts clear. Dr. Fenichel teaches math better than any college level professor I have taken classes with and I wish I had taken this class sooner. He does a great job of clearly describing these concepts and demonstrating real-world applications for linear algebra, calculus, and differential equations.
Eli was a fantastic instructor.
Math review was useful to other classes and research. The videos were very useful!
The class periods were well organized, clear, interactive, and fun. The problem sets were challenging but not too challenging to be great teaching tools.
Great material covered, great TA (Rob was fantastic), and Eli did a solid job bringing the highly theoretical to real world and practical. Favorite class of my semester here.
Dr. Fenichel did an excellent job putting material in context; this made it very easy to see the practical application of coursework.

For one, as mentioned in the previous question, we had a terrific teaching assistant who was able to respond to our questions with ease because of his very good grasp of the topics in class.Second, the value of understanding the mathematics is in being able to appreciate quantitative research and to distinguish god from bad research using mathematical models.The book on e was very useful in helping me appreciate the history of numbers that were relevant in the course. I'd recommend it to anyone who will be interested in a non-mathematical presentation of how we have reached this stage in mathematics regarding particular significant numbers.
Course lectures and problem sets were very well paced and very effective.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think some of the timing spent on subjects could have been improved, but this depends largely on the students in the class and their grasp on the topics. While some parts of the class were a bit slow for me, I recognize that other students were still struggling to grasp the topics. While this class is geared towards students with minimal mathematical foundations, a basic understanding certainly helps going into the class.
Some of the topics could have been covered a little more clearly in class.
Nothing
Eli's drawing skills.
I think we need a solid document to refer when we need. With the current structure of the class, it is difficult to refer back to what we learnt. Class notes and presentations might help!

The material should have been presented in a more organized manner. Like I've mentioned, the syllabus wasn't a very good reference for what will be covered. While eventually the links between topics became obvious towards the end, I don't feel that anyone without any background on the topics covered will have been able to have a very good appreciation of it given the broadness of the course.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The book e mirrored the class nicely and really clarified the real-world origins and history of these mathematical subjects. Although it seems silly at first, having e as a required reading was one of the best aspects of the class.
NA
There was required reading of the book 'e' (about the number) and 'book club' type discussions of it. The book was a great compliment to the class and the discussions were fun and useful.
N/A

There were no lab/discussion sections. I feel that this question should only be asked if such sections were part of the course. This is an unnecessary question, while the question on the TA should've been included.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I wish I had taken this course before Nature as Capital and before Graduate level economics courses. The materials provide a solid, mathematical foundation for succeeding in these classes.
Helps with modelig and understanding how to analyze data. Essential for any science student.
Helpful to stats classes and research.

The course provided me with a great understanding of math, which will be useful in all of my coursework. In particular, I was taking two econ classes concurrently and the review of derivatives, etc. was a great boon to my work in those classes.
As having very little math background, this class was incredibly important in building the foundational skill sets needed to go into other areas, fields, and courses of study.

The ability to appreciate different researches, including researches that are quantitative, I think is a basic skill that all students should have.I feel that more than economics, mathematics and how to appreciate it should be a foundation course in MEM.

This course for me was more of a refresher since it's been a few years since my undergrad math courses, but it actually provided me with a lot more than I expected. I gained a much better understanding of why I used various mathematical approaches rather than just memorizing them and forgetting them.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Strengthen my math background.
To review calculus.
Interest
See above.
I came across researches that are quantitative that I feel I needed to appreciate if only to be able to use the findings.
To gain a better understanding of applied math that I will be using for the quantitative aspects of my research going forward and in applied work after FES.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes. Whatever the class was lacking towards the end is made up for in the Nature as Capital class (ODE and Lagrangian).
Exceeded.
Yes
YES
Yes.
Yes

Yes, however I feel that I would have gained more if we also were exposed to more quantitative researches and understood the logic of the researches. That will have been able to clearly show the application of the math we were studying.

The knowledge and skills gained in this course exceeded my expectations. The conceptual understanding of mathematical approaches I gained in this course allowed me to solve problems on the final exam that I wouldn't have been able to solve even after multiple college calculus and engineering courses as an undergrad.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantages: helped me to understand the HW questions

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It helps to practice and review basic math and calculus concepts beforehand. Even starting to read e before the class starts could help. This will just make it that much easier to grasp the concepts.
TAKE IT!! especially if you're doing any kind of science/modeling/statistics. This was an absolutely wonderful class with a great instructor. Five stars.
TAKE IT! You will not regret it.
Take it!!
Take it!

I feel that the course is not basic even if the topics taught are foundational. Or another way of looking at it, more time should have been spent from simple straightforward problem solving to word problems and application to research. Thus, my advice is to make sure to have a very good foundation in mathematics to really appreciate the course.
If you have struggled with math in the past, TAKE THIS COURSE. Even if you haven't struggled with math but you want to be able to make the most of it, TAKE THIS COURSE.
